business.headline: Sensex crashes 1,200 points, Nifty falls below 24,000; IT stocks tumbleAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex ended 1190.34 points lower at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 to settle below 24,000.

Renewable energy stocks could make your portfolio green. 5 reasons whyWith the global shift towards clean energy, renewable energy stocks have proven to be rewarding for many, delivering strong returns.

Infosys, LTIM, HCLTech, TCS: Why IT stocks are tumbling todayInfosys led the decline with a 3% drop, while Tech Mahindra and LTIMindtree were down by 2.5%. HCLTech, MPhasis, and TCS also recorded losses exceeding 2%.

How this firm is blending sustainability in India's alcohol industryThe company's innovative approach, dubbed 'Grain to Glass', is transforming how businesses can contribute to environmental and social development.

Explained: Why newly-listed NTPC Green Energy shares gained 5% todayNTPC Green Energy share price: The latest surge follows NTPC Green Energy's announcement regarding the commercial operation of the first phase of its Shajapur Solar Project in Madhya Pradesh.

Suraksha Diagnostic IPO opens tomorrow: Check price band, issue size, GMPSuraksha Diagnostic IPO: The IPO will open for bidding on Friday and is expected to list on the stock exchanges on December 6, 2024.

Ola Electric shares continue positive rally, rise above Rs 90. Time to buy?Ola Electric share price: With this, the stock has gained over 35% in the last five sessions and has surpassed the Rs 90 target set by Citi on November 26.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: 4 reasons why Sensex plunged 1,200 points todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1190.34 points at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 points to 23,914.15.
Explained: Why LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade  LIC Stock Price: LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade despite a sharp drop in the benchmark stock market indices.

SpiceJet share price rises after Aircastle drops insolvency caseIn September, SpiceJet announced the resolution of a $23.39 million dispute with Aircastle (Ireland) Designated Activity Company and Wilmington Trust SP Services (Dublin) Limited.

Adani Total Gas share price jumps 16% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Total Gas share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 823.30 before settling at Rs 787, up 13.36% at 10:51 am.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.
Sensex, Nifty open flat; Adani group shares gain up to 10% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 17.08 points to 80,217.00, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 8.05 points to 24,282.95.

Enviro Infra Engineers listing: Does latest GMP signal a strong market debut? Enviro Infra Engineers listing: The initial public offering (IPO) of Enviro Infra Engineers saw strong investor interest through its 3-day bidding process as it was oversubscribed by 89.90 times.

Stocks to watch today: Adani, Waaree, PCBL, Vedanta, Godrej Properties Stocks to watch: In today's trade, shares of Adani Group, Waaree Renewable Technologies, Godrej Properties, Vedanta, and PCBL, among others, will be in focus due to various developments.

This is a hatchet job: Mahesh Jethmalani on Adani's US indictmentIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, senior advocate and former BJP Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jatmalani defended Gautam Adani and called the US indictment a 'hatchet job'.

Adani shares rally after clarification on US bribery charges. Is the worst over? Adani Power shares closed 20% higher at Rs 525.30, Adani Total Gas gained 19.76% to Rs 694.25, and Adani Enterprises rose 11.56% to Rs 2,398.35. These were the top gainers among all the listed Adani Group companies.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as Adani stocks rally up to 20% The S&P BSE Sensex added 230.02 points to close at 80,234.08, while the NSE NIfty50 gained 82.20 points to end at 24,276.70.

HDFC Life faces cyberattack: Fraudsters steal customer data, demand extortionThe breach occurred between November 19 and November 21, 2024 and the cybercriminals managed to steal personal information about HDFC Life's customers.

Ola Electric share price jumps 18%: Should you buy now or wait?The rally in Ola Electric shares followed the company's announcement of its new electric scooter lineup, which aims to make EVs more accessible across various segments.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Hemant Soren takes oath as Jharkhand Chief Minister at star-studded INDIA showThe ceremony was attended by several leaders, including Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin, and Bihar's Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav, among others.

Sambhal violence: Audio clip reveals how more people were mobilised with armsSambhal violence: The investigation team recovered the audio clip from mobile phones that were seized from the suspects. In the clip, an unidentified person can be heard giving a call for more people to be mobilised near the Shahi Jama Masjid.

Expert analysis suggests Supriya Sule's audio clip was manipulatedEarlier, a preliminary investigation by India Today, using three publicly available tools, had raised doubts about the authenticity of the clips allegedly involving NCP (SP) leader Supriya Sule.

S Jaishankar meets PM in Parliament, briefs him on Bangladesh violence: SourcesThe meeting comes amid spiralling violence against Hindus in Bangladesh. The minority community has faced more than 200 attacks since the fall of Sheikh Hasina's Awami League government on August 5.

At Emmys, Vir Das pun on Elon Musk in Trump 2.0: Self-driving but I have controlComedian Vir Das shared his International Emmy's opening monologue on social media. He scripted history by being the first Indian to host the ceremony.

Mahayuti allies eyeing key portfolios in new Maharashtra government: SourcesMahayuti allies will meet Amit Shah in Delhi today as BJP, Shiv Sena (Shinde faction), and Ajit Pawar-led NCP vie for critical portfolios in Maharashtra's cabinet reshuffle.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: 4 reasons why Sensex plunged 1,200 points todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1190.34 points at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 points to 23,914.15.

Was Ajmer Dargah a Shiva temple? What books, Hindu petitioner's evidence suggestA court in Rajasthan's Ajmer has issued notices to several authorities on a petition seeking a physical survey of Ajmer Dargah. The petitioner cited a book to say that the Ajmer Dargah was originally a Shiva temple. What does the book and other documents on the dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti suggest?

Bengaluru woman says flatmates rejected her for being 20 during house hunt. VideoThe Bengaluru woman narrated how she was keen on moving into the apartment and had been in touch with the flatmates, only to be turned down after visiting the house.

Use of Punjabi for sex assaults in Canada helps police nab Indian-origin suspectPeel Police cracked three cases of sexual assault within a week and arrested an Indian-origin man, Arshdeep Singh, for the crime in Brampton, Canada. What helped police crack the case was the use of Punjabi by the 22-year-old, who posed as a cab driver, to lure the women into his vehicle.

Team India meets Anthony Albanese, Australian PM reveals message to PM ModiAUS vs IND: The Indian team met the Australian Prime Minister, Anthony Albanese, in Canberra. The Indian team will face Australia Prime Minister's XI in a two-day practice match.

Trekking in Himachal's Dhauladhar range temporarily bannedExtra personnel will be deployed by the SP's office to assess weather forecasts from the Meteorological Department in Shimla before granting any permissions for trekking.

Think vaping is healthier than smoking? It affects sperm count, damages heartVaping, perceived as a safer smoking alternative, is rising globally, including in India. However, recent studies reveal it can harm vascular health even without nicotine.

Mahayuti's Delhi meet today, Devendra Fadnavis billed as favourite for top postFive days after the Mahayuti swept the Maharashtra polls, top leaders of the alliance will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi today with Devendra Fadnavis being viewed as the possible choice to become the next Chief Minister.

Lashkar terrorist, accused of funding terrorism in India, extradited from RwandaSalman Rehman Khan is accused of involvement in criminal conspiracy, membership in a terrorist organisation, and providing material support to the Pakistan-based LeT.

Watch: Rahul Gandhi captures Priyanka's Parliament debut in candid momentRahul Gandhi was seen clicking the picture of his sister Priyanka Gandhi as she began her journey as a Member of Parliament from the Wayanad constituency.

Hyundai Creta EV launch in India at Bharat Mobility 2025The Hyundai Creta EV will rival the Mahindra BE 6e, Tata Curvv EV, MG ZS EV, and the upcoming Maruti Suzuki e Vitara, which is based on the Maruti Suzuki eVX concept.

What sunk Sharad Pawar's NCP? Independents blowing their own 'trumpet'Contestants with the 'trumpet' symbol—closely resembling the NCP (SCP)'s 'tutari'—secured crucial votes in seats that Pawar's party lost narrowly in the Maharashtra polls

Cyclone Fengal set to intensify, heavy rainfall in several Tamil Nadu districts  Live UpdatesCyclone Fengal is expected to intensify and cross Tamil Nadu-Puducherry coasts by November 30. The Indian Navy is actively preparing for relief and rescue operations to mitigate the storm's impact.

China is turning its largest desert into a forestThe green belt is a crucial component of the Three-North Shelterbelt Forest Program (TSFP), which was launched in 1978 and is scheduled for completion in 2050.

Moana 2 review: Stunning visuals, but lacks the heart and charm of the originalReleased-Fri Nov 29, 2024Moana 2 movie review: Moana 2 enchants with its stunning visuals but struggles to match the heart and musical brilliance of its predecessor.

5 dogs found dead with mouths tied, Peta announces reward for details on accusedAn FIR was lodged on November 11 against unidentified individuals in connection with an incident where five dogs were found dead in a gutter in Mumbai with their mouths and legs tied.

Blast at shop near PVR in Delhi, white powder-like substance found on spotPrashant Vihar Blast: A loud explosion was heard near a PVR multiplex in Delhi today, prompting the police to rush to the spot and investigate the cause of the blast. A white powder-like substance was found at the spot.

Jharkhand butcher kills live-in partner, chops body into 50 piecesJharkhand Murder: According to the police, Naresh Bhengra and Gangi Kumari had been in a live-in relationship for the past few years, but he got married to another woman in Khunti without informing Kumari.

Christopher Nolan praises Dune 2: What a remarkable piece of workChristopher Nolan, acclaimed for his films like Inception, has lauded Denis Villeneuve's Dune 2 as 'remarkable'. The film, a sequel to the 2021 adaptation of Frank Herbert's novel, is celebrated for its storytelling and visuals.

Video: Dua Lipa arrives in Mumbai for her upcoming concertGlobal pop sensation Dua Lipa was clicked as she arrived in Mumbai for her upcoming concert. The singer will headline the Zomato Feeding India Concert (ZFIC) on November 30 at MMRDA, BKC in Mumbai.

Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 locked and loaded, makers finish final editingThe much-anticipated Pushpa 2: The Rule, directed by Sukumar and starring Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna, has completed its editing process. The film is ready for release on December 5.

Ibrahim Ali Khan's Sarzameen targets Republic Day 2025 release | ExclusiveIbrahim Ali Khan's debut film Sarzameen, co-starring Kajol and Prithviraj Sukumaran, targets a January 2025 release. Directed by Kayoze Irani, the patriotic drama explores terrorism in Kashmir.

sports.headline: Bhuvneshwar Kumar pens 'goodbye' message to SRH after expensive RCB switchBhuvneshwar Kumar bids farewell to Sunrisers Hyderabad after 11 years, joining Royal Challengers Bangalore for a record-breaking Rs 10.75 crore in the IPL 2025 auction, marking a new chapter in his illustrious career.

Australian minister, a Virat Kohli fan, relishes meeting with batting starAssistant minister of external affairs of Australia, Tim Watts, was in awe after meeting Virat Kohli at Parliament House in Canberra.

Lampard named new Coventry City manager and EFL Championship return setChelsea legend Frank Lampard begins a crucial managerial stint at Coventry City, taking charge of the Championship side to stabilise their season. With the club in a precarious position, Lampard faces immense pressure to reignite their fortunes.

Michael Vaughan reveals Sourav Ganguly sent him a text predicting India's Perth Test winFormer England captain Michael Vaughan revealed that Sourav Ganguly had predicted India's victory in Perth Test through a text message.
India vs Australia PM's XI pink ball practice Test: When and where to watchAUS vs IND: Find out all the live-streaming details of India's pink ball warm-up game against Australia Prime Minister's XI.

Fancy a loan move?: Bengaluru FC's praises KL Rahul's Perth keepy-uppiesBengaluru FC humorously lauded KL Rahul's viral keepy-uppie skills, sparking laughter and admiration on social media while celebrating his match-winning cricketing performance during India's dominant victory against Australia in the Perth Test.

Watch: Rohit Sharma delivers speech at Australian Parliament HouseIndian captain Rohit Sharma delivered a speech at Australia's Parliament House in Canberra. The Indian team was hosted by Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on November 28, Thursday.

Prithvi Shaw is as talented a player as I ever worked with: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting reacted to Prithvi Shaw going unsold in the IPL2025 mega auction. Shaw had set his base price at Rs 75 lakh and still could not attract any bids.

PM Anthony hosted the Indian team at the Parliament House in Canberra on Thursday, November 28.

My doping ban will be lifted if I join BJP: Bajrang PuniaBajrang Punia was handed a four-year ban by the National Anti-Doping Agency on Tuesday. The Tokyo Olympics bronze medalist accused the Bharatiya Janata Party of targeting him for having been one of the faces of the wrestlers' protest against Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh.

KL Rahul to Bengaluru FC? Cricketer sends a message to Parth Jindal after IPL auctionStar India batter KL Rahul asked his new owner Parth Jindal about any openings in his football team Bengaluru FC after exhibiting his football skills on the cricket ground during the first Test against Australia in Perth.

Stokes-McCullum need series win vs IND or AUS to call Bazball a success: CookFormer England captain Alastair Cook said that Brendon McCullum and Ben Stokes need a marquee series win under their belt - either against Australia or India. Cook made on the sidelines of the opening Test match between England and New Zealand.

First time since 2018: Kane Williamson departs in nervous nineties vs EnglandKane Williamson narrowly missed out on his 33rd Test hundred as he was dismissed by 93 by Gus Atkinson. This was the first time since 2018 when Williamson departed in nervous nineties.

Man United willing to help Marcus Rashford: Amorim on struggling starManchester United manager Ruben Amorim has said that the club is willing to help struggling forward Marcus Rashford if the player wants to get better. Amorim made his comments after Man United's 1-1- draw vs Ipswich.

Despite Kane Williamson's 93, England dominate Day 1 of 1st Test vs New ZealandNZ vs ENG: Kane Williamson scored a brilliant 93 as New Zealand ended Day 1 at 319/8. Shoaib Bashir was the pick among the English bowlers with four wickets at Hagley Oval.

Mbappe lacking in confidence: Real Madrid boss after loss vs LiverpoolReal Madrid forward Kylian Mbappe is struggling to score due to lack of confidence, feels coach Carlo Ancelotti. The coach made his comments after his team's 0-2 loss vs Liverpool.

Rishabh Pant's ambitions are clear, he wants to captain India: Parth JindalDelhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal said that Rishabh Pant is very clear in his ambition. Jindal said that Pant one day, wants to captain the Indian cricket team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
